Passage : By analyzing the light released or absorbed by the atoms of an object, we can measure whether the object is far away from earth or close to the earth. when the object is far away from the earth, the frequency of these light will shift to the red end of the ( low frequency ), referred to as " redshift ", on the contrary it is called " blue shift ". This unique light emitted by atoms is also affected by the mass of the elementary particles that make up the atoms especially electrons.
